et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et exaudī mē. Contrīstātus sum in exercitātiōne meā
my prayer: ^ Be attentive to me and hear me. I am grieved in my exercise; and am troubled

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et ā trībulātiōne peccātōris. Quoniam dēclīnāvērunt in mē inīquitātēs
O God: et in īrā molestī erant mihi. ^ At the voice of the enemy
my prayer: and at the tribulation of the sinner. For they have cast iniquities upon me
and in wrath they were troublesome to me.

2 ^ Exaudī Deus ōrātiōnem meam: 5 ^ Cor meum conturbātum est in mē
et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et formīdō mortis cecidit super mē. ^ My heart is troubled within me
O God: and the fear of death is fallen upon me.

2 ^ Exaudī Deus ōrātiōnem meam: 6 ^ Timor et tremor vēnērunt super mē
et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et contēxērunt mē tenebrae. ^ Fear and trembling are come upon me

2 ^ Exaudī Deus ōrātiōnem meam: 7 ^ Et dīxī: Quis dabit mihi pennās sīcut columbae
et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et volābō et requiēscem? ^ And I said: Who will give me wings like a dove
O God: and I will fly and be at rest?

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et mansī in sōlitūdine. ^ Lo
O God: I have gone far off flying away; and I abode in the wilderness.

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: quī salvum mē fēcit ā pusillanimitāte spīritūs
O God: et tempestāte. ^ I waited for him that hath saved me from pusillanimity of spirit

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: Domine; dīvide linguās eōrum; quoniam vīdī inīquitātem et contrādictiōnem in cīvitāte. ^ Cast down
my prayer: and divide their tongues; for I have seen iniquity and contradiction in the city.

2 ^ Exaudī Deus ōrātiōnem meam: 11 ^ Diē ac nocte circumdabit eam super mūrōs ejus inīquitās
et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et labor in mediō ejus
O God: ^ Day and night shall iniquity surround it upon its walls
my prayer: and in the midst thereof are labour

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et nōn dēfēcit dē platēīs ejus ūsūra et dolus. ^ And injustice. And usury and deceit have not departed from its streets.

2 ^ Exaudī Deus ōrātiōnem meam: 13 ^ Quoniam sī inimīcus meus maledīxisset mihi
et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: sustinuissem utique. Et sī is quī ōderat mē super mē magna locūtus fuisset
O God: abscondissem mē forsitan ab eō. ^ For if my enemy had reviled me
my prayer: I would verily have borne with it. And if he that hated me had spoken great things against me
I would perhaps have hidden my self from him.

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: dux meus
O God: et nōtus meus; ^ But thou a man of one mind

2 ^ Exaudī Deus ōrātiōnem meam: 15 ^ Quī simul mēcum dulcēs capiēbās cibōs; in domō Deī ambulāvimus cum consensū. ^ Who didst take sweetmeats together with me; in the house of God we walked with consent.

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et dēscendant in infernum vīventēs; quoniam nēquitiae in habitāculīs eōrum
O God: in mediō eōrum. ^ Let death come upon them
my prayer: and let them go down alive into hell. For there is wickedness in their dwellings

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et Dominus salvābit mē. ^ But I have cried to God
O God: and the Lord will save me.

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et māne
my prayer: et exaudiet vōcem meam. ^ Evening and morning
and at noon I will speak and declare
column6: and he shall hear my voice.

2 ^ Exaudī Deus ōrātiōnem meam: 19 ^ Redimet in pāce animam meam ab hīs
et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: quī appropinquant mihi
O God: quoniam inter multōs erant mēcum. ^ He shall redeem my soul in peace from them
my prayer: those that draw near to me
for among many they were with me.

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et humiliābit illōs
O God: quī est ante saecula. Nōn enim est illīs commūtātiō
my prayer: et nōn timuērunt Deum. ^ God shall hear
and the Eternal shall humble them. For there is no change with them
column6: and they have not feared God.

2 ^ Exaudī Deus ōrātiōnem meam: 21 ^ Extendit manum suam in retribuendō; contāmināvērunt testāmentum ejus; ^ He hath stretched forth his hand to repay. They have defiled his covenant
22 ^ dīvīsī sunt ab īrā vultūs ejus
et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et appropinquāvit cor illīus. Mollītī sunt sermōnēs ejus super oleum
O God: et ipsī sunt jacula. ^ They are divided by the wrath of his countenance
my prayer: and his heart hath drawn near. His words are smoother than oil

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: et ipse tē ēnūtriet; nōn dabit in aeternum fluctuātiōnem jūstō. ^ Cast thy care upon the Lord
O God: and he shall sustain thee; he shall not suffer the just to waver for ever.

et nē dēspexerīs dēprecātiōnem meam; ^: Deus
O God: dēdūcēs eōs in puteum interitūs. Virī sanguinum
my prayer: et dolōsī nōn dīmidiābunt diēs suōs; egō autem spērābō in tē Domine. ^ But thou
column6: shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction. Bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee
